titleStmt.title: Inscription in honour of the praet. prefect Probus from Rome (Pincio) made by the council of Venetia and Histria

summary.term: Honorary inscription for the praetorian prefect Petronius Probus

support.rs: yes (the frontal epigraphic field is deeply recessed in relation to the moulding, which is possibly the result of the cancelling of an earlier inscription, so also LSA)

layout.p: Two inscribed fields: frontal field (frons) for the main inscription and left side (latus sin.) for engraving the date of dedication of the statue.
layout.rs: Undamaged. The text is left-aligned (‘flagged’) with blanks on the right-hand side of the lines 2-3 and 5-12; the gentilicium of the honoree on line 8 and his role as patronus on line 15 are centred.

origPlace.placeName: private building (very probably in the domus Pinciana)

history.provenance: Rome, statue base engraved on two sides, found in 1742 behind the apse of the church of the Trinità de’ Monti (Pincian Hill)

div.p: Edition based on CIL and inspection of the original engraving. Text seen and verified by Porena 2018, Angius 2020.

app.note: Illirycum, La Rocca, Parisi Presicce 2010 (transcr. by C. Corradetti)
peculia Reseius, La Rocca, Parisi Presicce 2010 (transcr. by C. Corradetti)

div.p: “To the summit of the nobility, to the light of letters and eloquence, to the model of authority, to the master of provident administration, to the promoter of humanity, to the patron of moderation, to the champion of devotion, to Petronius Probus, of clarissimus rank, proconsul of Africa, praetorian prefect of Illyricum, Italia and Africa, ordinary consul, for the extraordinary forms of help towards them, the inhabitants of Venetia and Istria, his own particular clients, (dedicate) to their most generous patron.
Dedicated on the sixth day before the Ides of August, during the consulate of our masters the Augusti Valens for the sixth time and Valentinianus for the second time”.

“Au sommet de la noblesse, à la lumière des lettres et de l’éloquence, à l’exemple d’autorité, au maître des dispositions prévoyantes, au promoteur de l’humanité, au champion de la modération, au ‘prêtre’ de la dévotion, à Petronius Probus, clarissime proncosul d’Afrique, préfet du prétoire pour l’Illyricum, l’Italie et l’Afrique, consul ordinaire, pour les formes extraordinaires d’aide qu’il leur a prodiguées, les Vénètes et les Istriens, ses clients particuliers, (dédient) à leur patron très remarquable.
Dédiée le sixième jour avant les ides d’Août, sous le consulat de nos seigneurs les Augustes Valens pour la sixième fois et Valentinien pour la deuxième fois”.

“Al culmine della nobiltà, al faro delle lettere e dell’eloquenza, al modello di autorità, al maestro dei provvedimenti e delle disposizioni (amministrative), al promotore del genere umano, al campione di moderazione, all’antesignano del doveroso affetto (verso i principi e verso i clienti), al chiarissimo Petronius Probus, proncosole d’Africa, prefetto del pretorio di Illyricum Italia e Africa, console ordinario, per le straordinarie forme di aiuto verso di loro, i Veneti e gli Istri, suoi clienti particolari, (dedicano) al loro disponibilissimo patrono.
Dedicata il sesto giorno prima delle idi di agosto, durante il consolato dei nostri signori Augusti Valente per la sesta volta e Valentiniano per la seconda volta”.

The inscription was made by the provincial council of the province of venetia et Histria to their patron, the former praetorian prefect of Italy Illyricum Africa, the very powerful Petronius Probus. His family had extensive properties in the Venetia. The statue was placed by the clients in the atrium of the senator’s domus Pinciana in Rome, complete with the cursus honorum ruled and known up to that date. The explicit date (8th August 378) allows us to establish that at that date Probus had been praetorian prefect only once.
